item.title: Evolution, phylogenetics, and phylogenetic model selection: jmodeltest vs. DT_ModSel
item.description: Evolution is the central unifying theme in all biology–“Nothing makes sense in biology except in the light of evolution,” said Dobzhansky. Two of the most important contributions of Darwin to this field were (1) acceptance and priority of the reality and importance of individual variation (selection acts on individuals, evolutionary changes surface in populations…) and (2) the first phylogenetic tree with the accompanying hypothesis that all organisms share a common ancestry that can be visualized as a hierarchical branching design.
